page.title: 01WALKS AROUND HOLT
page.content: The village of Holt is surrounded by lots of beautiful countryside. There are many slopes that you can climb, which have fascinating views of Holt. There are lovely trees and hedgerows full of wild flowers. There are lots of quiet roads for you to wander along once you are out of the main part of the village. There are many footpaths in and around Holt. Although most of them are marked on maps, quite often they are not very easy to find. An example is the footpath that leads from Leigh Road to Hunt's Hall Farm. When you get over the stile, it is impossible to see which way you are meant to go. At the other side of the field, there isn't even a stile and you have to go over a barbed-wire fence. Most of the other footpaths are better than this, because they are used more often.
